body: I sometimes wish some of Tsukusun's works continued on further. Feel like he ends his works right when they get interesting or leave room for further development.

Plain cruel, but i can't ignore the beauty of the drawing and those delicious camera angling. Hope those poor children that we're unaware of irl are resurrected in a life where they are happy.

So I’m trying to piece this together. The mom knew Monica was prostituting herself for cheap medicine but said screw it I want to live so goodbye child. Then Monica meets the exact same person she’s about to live on in and her last days/heart torture are imprinted into this other woman.

I've actually seen some studies that say something similar and while the heart cant actually retain memories people with bad eating habits that got the hearts of healthier people usually change their diet to one that's close to the original owner

This piece feels like South America, Brazil to be exact... it feels fresh and hot, with notes of unfair living and shitty places, where kids are being used almost as machines to produce money.
